alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 22 at 5:23PM AKST until January 23 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE... .Snowfall continues across the northern panhandle with some pockets of freezing rain along the transition zone between Kake and along the outer coast to Yakutat. Over the inner channels near Juneau, snow has started to become wetter but remaining cold enough to stay as snow. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 14 to 20 inches. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commutes. Increased snow load may affect vessels and other property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will increase through Monday evening. Snow will become wetter however, there is a lower threat of freezing rain. A mix is likely Tuesday evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to check on their property. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
